car
Basic explanation of words
car
(car)
chÄ“
Vehicles with wheels on land: trains. Car driving (the emperor's carriage). Chess (a cruel death penalty in ancient China, commonly known as "five horses to divide the body"). Lessons from the past.
An appliance that uses a wheel to rotate: a spinning wheel. Waterwheel.
Fetching water with a water tanker: water tanker.
Refers to lathes or other machines: lathes.
Machining workpieces with a lathe: turning parts.
Dialect, turning the body: the body. The car passed.
name.
car
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ] [chÄ“]
["Guangyun" Ruler cover cut, Pingma, Chang. ]
["Guangyun" Nine fish cut, flat fish, see. ]
Traditional characters for "è½¦1".
(1) Cars, vehicles on land with wheels.
(2) Especially refers to military vehicles.
(3) Refers to the impeller that propels the hull forward.
(4) Chariots, people who drive cars.
(5) Generally refers to tools that rotate on wheels.
(6) Machining and cutting objects. Today mostly refers to cutting things with a lathe.
(7) Refers to sewing with a machine.
(8) The water tanker holds water.
(9) Shipment by car.
(10) Rotating; turning sideways.
(11) Gum.
(12) Quantifiers. Calculate the unit of capacity contained in a vehicle.
(13) Last name. Han has a car forever.

Name meaning
: A vehicle with wheels installed on land. It also refers to a machine, such as a lathe, or a tool that uses a wheel to rotate, such as a waterwheel. Metaphor people have great talents and are capable of important tasks
